intro: Rhipsalis floccosa subsp. pulvinigera, commonly known as the silver-tipped rhipsalis, is a species of cactus native to Brazil. It is characterized by its soft, hair-like stems that give it a fluffy appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. This subspecies is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique and elegant appearance.
